neighbors.name: Anthony J. & Debra A. Hofmann
neighbors.claims: Debra A. Hofmann is listed as residing at 4705 E County Road 900 S in rural Cloverdale, Putnam County ([Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/4705-E-County-Road-900-S-Cloverdale-IN-46120/85673519_zpid/)). Public records confirm the Hofmanns as local landowners, but no news articles or civic roles were found associated with them ([Putnam County Assessor](https://co.putnam.in.us/assessor)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Private landowners; no public roles noted

approach_recommendations.engage: Initiate personal outreach to build rapport. Given the intense local opposition to the 4Leaf Solar project in Cloverdale, emphasize listening and transparency. Avoid assuming neutrality despite the lack of public statements.

citations.claim: Debra A. Hofmann is listed as residing at 4705 E County Road 900 S
citations.title: 4705 E County Road 900 S, Cloverdale, IN 46120

citations.claim: Public records confirm the Hofmanns as local landowners
citations.title: Putnam County Assessor Property Records

neighbors.name: Cynthia L. Ogborn
neighbors.claims: Cynthia L. “Cindy” Ogborn resides at 4690 E County Road 875 S in Cloverdale, Indiana ([Xome](https://www.xome.com/realestate/IN/Cloverdale/46120/County-Rd-750?page=7)). Her property spans roughly 12.7 acres with a home built in 1994 ([Realtor](https://www.realtor.com/propertyrecord-search/46120/E-County-Road-875-S)). While no direct civic role was found for Cynthia, a Brad Ogborn serves as Director of Transportation for the South Putnam Community School Corporation, suggesting potential family ties to local administration ([South Putnam Schools](https://www.sputnam.k12.in.us/staff)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Rural homeowner; possible school board tie

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach Ms. Ogborn with respect for her long-term residency. Be aware of potential connections to the school district administration. Focus on how the project addresses concerns raised by the Putnam County Rural Preservation Society.

neighbors.name: Jami K. & Richard “Shane” Cox
neighbors.claims: Jami K. Cox and her husband Richard “Shane” Cox are identified in county land records as co-owners of parcels in this part of Putnam County ([Putnam County Assessor](https://co.putnam.in.us/assessor)). Jami K. Cox is also listed as an owner of property on E Washington St in Greencastle ([Beacon](http://auditor.putnamcounty67.us/cgi.exe?CALL_PROGRAM=C009INFO&FINDINFO=00000013130&TAXYEAR=2024&ORIGIN=B)). No public commentary on development was found for this specific couple, though the name 'Shane Cox' appears in unrelated regional records.
neighbors.influence_justification: No known public profile

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Cox family through a direct, informal introduction. Given the high solar opposition in Cloverdale, provide clear facts about setbacks and screening. Clarify if they reside at the rural parcel or the Greencastle address.

citations.claim: Identified in county land records as co-owners
citations.title: Putnam County Assessor Property Search

citations.claim: Jami K. Cox is also listed as an owner of property on E Washington St in Greencastle
citations.title: Putnam County Auditor Property Record 730 E Washington

neighbors.name: Michael E. Smith
neighbors.claims: Michael E. Smith is listed as the owner of the parcel at 4655 E County Road 900 S, Cloverdale, per property records ([Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/4655-E-County-Road-900-S-Cloverdale-IN-46120/85673521_zpid/)). The property includes a home built in 1999 on approximately 2.5 acres ([Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/4655-E-County-Road-900-S-Cloverdale-IN-46120/85673521_zpid/)). No public commentary or civic roles were found associated with this individual in Putnam County development hearings.
neighbors.influence_justification: Unlisted in public forums

approach_recommendations.engage: Conduct low-key, personal outreach. Confirm if he is the primary resident. Be prepared to discuss visual screening, as the property is a smaller residential parcel (2.5 acres) likely sensitive to viewshed changes.

neighbors.name: Clayton D. Cordell Jr. & Alayssa L. Cordell
neighbors.claims: Clayton D. "Doug" Cordell Jr., a U.S. Army veteran, passed away on Feb. 12, 2024, at age 67 ([Owen-Weilert-Duncan](https://www.owenweilertduncan.com/obituaries/Clayton-D-Doug-Cordell?obId=30869044)). The Cordell property is located in an area where the 2,000-acre 4Leaf/EnergyRe solar farm was proposed and subsequently rejected by Putnam County Commissioners in October 2025 ([Terre Haute Vice](https://terrehautevice.com/2025/10/07/putnam-says-no-residents-commissioners-reject-2000-acre-solar-proposal/)). Alayssa L. Cordell is identified as a family member in related obituaries ([Dignity Memorial](https://www.dignitymemorial.com/obituaries/indianapolis-in/dewayne-chernovsky-9081522)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Deceased owner; widow's influence unknown

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected farming peer or local veteran approach Alayssa Cordell, emphasizing how project plans protect farmland use and maintain the area’s quiet rural character.

citations.claim: Clayton D. "Doug" Cordell Jr., a U.S. Army veteran, passed away on Feb. 12, 2024, at age 67
citations.title: Obituary for Clayton D. Cordell

citations.claim: The Cordell property is located in an area where the 2,000-acre 4Leaf/EnergyRe solar farm was proposed and subsequently rejected by Putnam County Commissioners in October 2025
citations.title: Putnam Says No: Commissioners Reject 2,000-Acre Solar Proposal

citations.claim: Alayssa L. Cordell is identified as a family member in related obituaries
citations.title: Obituary for DeWayne Chernovsky

neighbors.name: Johnnie L. Chestnut
neighbors.claims: Johnnie L. Chestnut is a certified financial planner (CFP) and investment advisor representative based in Cloverdale, Indiana, currently affiliated with Osaic Advisory Services ([AdvisorCheck](https://www.advisorcheck.com/advisor/3262183-johnnie-lee-chestnut-osaic-advisory-services-llc-cloverdale-indiana)). He has worked in the finance industry since 1999 and operates Chestnut Financial Group LLC ([Experience.com](https://www.experience.com/reviews/johnnie-22016068)). No public record of Chestnut taking a formal position on the 4Leaf Solar project or other local development issues was found in county meeting minutes.
neighbors.influence_justification: Local financial advisor and business owner

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach through a fellow business professional or community leader to discuss how the project will safeguard nearby property values and preserve the area’s tranquility, addressing any financial or quality-of-life concerns.

neighbors.name: Tyler K. Lotz & Jessica P. Winders
neighbors.claims: Tyler K. Lotz serves as the head football coach at Cloverdale High School, a role he has held since at least 2022 ([GIANT fm](https://www.giant.fm/putnam-county/news/local-news/cloverdale-ready-for-new-season-future-changes/)). Jessica P. Winders is identified as his partner in family obituaries ([Baldwin Cremation](https://baldwincremation.com/obituaries/william-bill-thomas-terrell/)). There is no public record of Lotz or Winders speaking publicly about the 4Leaf Solar project or other energy developments in Putnam County.
neighbors.influence_justification: High school head coach; local educator

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a trusted educator or coach from the area talk with the couple, highlighting how project plans include visual screening and noise minimization to preserve the peaceful, scenic environment they value.

neighbors.name: Tyson D. Hillenburg & Jillianne N. Hillenburg
neighbors.claims: Tyson D. Hillenburg has been linked to business operations in Cloverdale, including a local Subway franchise ([Where-Food](https://cloverdale-in.where-food.com/subwayrestaurants-10311/)). Family records indicate the Hillenburgs have ties to the Bedford, Indiana area, where Jillianne is listed as a family member in local obituaries ([Ferguson-Lee](https://www.fergusonlee.com/obituaries/Anna-Mae-Henderson?obId=31679314)). Neither Tyson nor Jillianne have publicly voiced opinions on the recent solar farm proposals in Putnam County.
neighbors.influence_justification: Local business connection; no political role

approach_recommendations.engage: Connect via a local agriculture extension or conservation official who can address how the project will protect farmland integrity and manage water drainage, reassuring the Hillenburgs that their land and crops won’t be adversely affected.

neighbors.name: Damon Cox & Jannllie Cox
neighbors.claims: Damon B. Cox and his spouse Jannllie Cox reside on a property along County Road 900 South in Cloverdale ([source](https://www.dignitymemorial.com/obituaries/greencastle-in/floyd-decker-11410884)). In 2022, Damon Cox appeared before the Putnam County Board of Zoning Appeals to request a variance for a temporary second dwelling while constructing a new home on the property; the variance was approved ([source](https://irp.cdn-website.com/238c8e41/files/uploaded/Approved+March+Minutes.pdf)). No public statements regarding renewable energy development were located in available records.
neighbors.influence_justification: Private resident; petitioner for personal zoning variance

approach_recommendations.engage: Address concerns about home resale value and views via visual buffers, acknowledging his recent investment in building a new home on the property.

No record of Payne taking a public position on local development issues was found in news or meeting archives ([source](https://indianaeconomicdigest.net/MobileContent/Default/Major-Indiana-News/Article/Putnam-County-Commissioners-set-moratorium-for-solar-farms-and-more/-3/5308/120492)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Newer property owner; no public office found

neighbors.name: Carl D. Grove & Marilyn S. Grove
neighbors.claims: Carl D. Grove and Marilyn S. Grove are long-time residents of the area; Carl Grove appears in local records as early as 1957 regarding school district consolidation ([source](https://newspapers.library.in.gov/cgi-bin/indiana?a=d&d=TDB19570425-01.1.1)). Marilyn Grove has been active in the local faith community and is a known resident of Cloverdale ([source](https://www.dignitymemorial.com/obituaries/greencastle-in/ellen-cash-8950585)). No evidence was found of the family speaking at public meetings regarding recent solar development proposals ([source](https://indianaeconomicdigest.net/MobileContent/Default/Major-Indiana-News/Article/Putnam-County-Area-Plan-Commission-recommends-denying-solar-rezone-of-1-200-acres/-3/5308/115778)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Long-time resident; no recent public office

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach with respect for their long tenure; discuss farmland preservation and drainage to honor their legacy.

neighbors.name: Seth & Rachel Barrier
neighbors.claims: Seth and Rachel Barrier are residents of the Cloverdale area in Putnam County ([National Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/b/seth-barrier/)). Their property is located in the vicinity of the proposed 4Leaf Solar Farm, a project that faced significant community opposition during 2025 hearings. County officials reported that 386 people submitted letters against the development versus only 25 in favor ([Giant FM](https://www.giant.fm/putnam-county/news/local-news/putnam-county-plan-commission-votes-down-solar-farm-rezone-request/)). The project was ultimately rejected by the County Commissioners in October 2025 following a recommendation of denial from the Plan Commission ([Terre Haute Vice](https://terrehautevice.com/2025/10/07/putnam-says-no-residents-commissioners-reject-2000-acre-solar-proposal/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Local residents; no public office found

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a trusted local farm leader speak with the Barriers about how land stewardship and property values will be protected, highlighting long-term farmland preservation measures.

citations.claim: Seth and Rachel Barrier are residents of the Cloverdale area
citations.title: Seth Barrier - Cloverdale, IN

citations.claim: 386 people submitted letters against the development versus only 25 in favor
citations.title: Putnam County Plan Commission votes down solar farm rezone request

citations.claim: Project rejected by Commissioners in October 2025
citations.title: Putnam Says No: Residents, Commissioners Reject 2,000-Acre Solar Proposal

neighbors.name: Eric B. Kaufman
neighbors.claims: Eric B. Kaufman is listed as a landowner in rural Putnam County. The area was subject to the proposed 300 MW 4Leaf Solar Farm, which was rejected by the County Plan Commission in September 2025 due to overwhelming community opposition ([Giant FM](https://www.giant.fm/putnam-county/news/local-news/putnam-county-plan-commission-votes-down-solar-farm-rezone-request/)). No public statements from Kaufman regarding the project were found in local records. (Note: A prominent 'Eric Kaufman' appears in records for Putnam County, Ohio; verification of this individual's specific presence in Putnam County, Indiana, relies solely on tax roll data not publicly indexed in news snippets).
neighbors.influence_justification: Private landowner; not publicly active

approach_recommendations.engage: Address his practical concerns directly – for example, explain drainage plans and road use limits – through a personal visit by a project engineer alongside a respected neighbor to build confidence.

citations.claim: Rejected by the County Plan Commission in September 2025
citations.title: Putnam County Plan Commission votes down solar farm rezone request

neighbors.name: Nathan D. & Katrina M. Skirvin
neighbors.claims: Katrina “Kate” Skirvin is a veteran agriculture teacher at North Putnam High School who received a 2022 national award as an Outstanding Agricultural Educator ([North Putnam Schools](https://www.nputnam.k12.in.us/o/nphs/article/930909)). She serves as an appointed member of the Putnam County Plan Commission (2025-2029) ([Putnam County Government](https://co.putnam.in.us/building-and-planning)). In her official capacity, Skirvin voted against the 4Leaf Solar rezone request in September 2025 ([Giant FM](https://www.giant.fm/putnam-county/news/local-news/putnam-county-plan-commission-votes-down-solar-farm-rezone-request/)). Additionally, she presented on the risks of industrial solar projects to agricultural land at a January 2025 community forum organized by the Putnam County Rural Preservation Society ([PCRPS](https://pcrps.carrd.co/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Plan Commission member; award-winning teacher

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage her with peer experts in agriculture – for example, invite an agricultural extension specialist to discuss how the solar farm can co-exist with farming and protect land for future generations.

citations.claim: Received a 2022 national award as an Outstanding Agricultural Educator
citations.title: Kate Skirvin Selected for National Award

citations.claim: Appointed member of the Putnam County Plan Commission (2025-2029)
citations.title: Putnam County Building and Planning - Board Members

citations.claim: Voted against the 4Leaf Solar rezone request in September 2025
citations.title: Putnam County Plan Commission votes down solar farm rezone request

citations.claim: Presented on the risks of industrial solar projects... at a January 2025 community forum

neighbors.name: J. B. Michael
neighbors.claims: J. B. Michael is a long-time resident who farms trees in Putnam County and is an alumnus of Wabash College (Class of 1969) ([Wabash College](https://bulletin.wabash.edu/scholarships/restricted-scholarships/)). He owns land in the southern part of the county, near the area of the rejected 4Leaf solar project. While hundreds of residents voiced concerns about the project's impact on rural scenery and noise during 2025 hearings, Michael has no documented public comments on the development ([Giant FM](https://www.giant.fm/putnam-county/news/local-news/putnam-county-plan-commission-votes-down-solar-farm-rezone-request/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Tree farmer; Wabash College alumni leader

approach_recommendations.engage: Emphasize measures to preserve the quiet, scenic nature of his surroundings – for example, via visual buffers and noise minimization – delivered in a personal conversation by a neighbor he trusts who supports the project.

citations.title: Wabash College Restricted Scholarships - Michael Scholarship

neighbors.name: Logan Buis
neighbors.claims: Logan Buis is a resident of Putnam County and identified as the grandson of long-time Greencastle resident Doris Jean McMains ([Hopkins-Rector](https://www.dignitymemorial.com/obituaries/greencastle-in/doris-mcmains-11040902)). While the Buis Family Trust appears in county planning documents, no direct references to Logan Buis speaking on development matters were found in local government minutes as of January 2026 ([Putnam County Plan Commission](https://irp.cdn-website.com/238c8e41/files/uploaded/Plan+Commission+Minutes+June+9+2025.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Private resident; no public office found

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via informal, one-on-one outreach stressing respect for agricultural land use. Having a fellow local farmer or trusted community member introduce the development plans could help build trust.

neighbors.claims: Julie M. Toebbe works as a Human Resources Manager with Pools of Fun in Plainfield, Indiana ([Growjo](https://growjo.com/company/Pools_of_Fun)). Mark and Julie Toebbe are residents of Cloverdale, Indiana, recently participating in local community memorials as of July 2025 ([Whitaker Funeral Home](https://www.whitakerfunerals.net/obituary/Larry-Grounds)). Neither Mark nor Julie Toebbe is mentioned in local public meetings regarding community development ([Putnam County Plan Commission](https://irp.cdn-website.com/238c8e41/files/uploaded/Plan+Commission+Minutes+June+9+2025.pdf)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Toebbes through a neighborly conversation or community open house. Emphasize how the project addresses common resident concerns like property values and traffic safety in order to earn their understanding.

neighbors.name: State Of Indiana
neighbors.claims: The State of Indiana owns property along County Road 900 S, likely associated with the Department of Natural Resources and the nearby Lieber State Recreation Area/Cagles Mill Lake ([source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cagles_Mill_Lake)). The property is classified as exempt/state-owned land ([source](https://www.loopnet.com/property/8407-e-county-road-900-s-cloverdale-in-46120/18133-671325300023000010/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: State government entity; statutory authority

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with IDNR regarding setbacks and environmental impact on nearby state recreation areas.

neighbors.name: Buis Farms Eight LLC
neighbors.claims: Buis Farms Eight LLC holds farmland in Putnam County and is associated with the local Buis family farming enterprise (Mike & Jeff Buis Partnership) ([EWG](https://farm.ewg.org/top_recips.php?fips=18133&progcode=total_de&regionname=PutnamCounty,Indiana)). The Buis partnership, based in nearby Martinsville, IN, is a recipient of federal farm subsidies, reflecting the scale of their farm operations ([EWG](https://farm.ewg.org/top_recips.php?fips=18133&progcode=total_de&regionname=PutnamCounty,Indiana)). Mike Buis has served in leadership roles for agricultural organizations like the Indiana Corn Growers Association ([Indiana Soybean Alliance](https://issuu.com/indianasoybeanassociation/docs/icsp_janfeb_2025_012125_web)). No public records indicate Buis Farms Eight LLC taking an active position for or against development projects in the area.
neighbors.influence_justification: Multi-generational farm family with substantial acreage and leadership in state agricultural associations; locally known but not overtly politically active on solar issues.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Buis family principals (e.g., Mike Buis) with respect for their farming legacy; emphasize how any project can coexist with or enhance agricultural use to address their concerns.

citations.claim: Associated with Buis family farming enterprise and recipient of subsidies
citations.title: EWG Farm Subsidy Database - Putnam County, IN

citations.claim: Mike Buis served in leadership for Indiana Corn Growers Association
citations.title: Indiana Corn & Soybean Post Jan/Feb 2025

neighbors.name: Fred Mann Farm Inc
neighbors.claims: Fred Mann Farm Inc is a family-run farm corporation historically led by Fred O. Mann, headquartered in Cloverdale, Indiana ([National Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/m/fred-mann/in/)). The company’s address (5008 E State Rd 42) houses multiple Mann family business entities, indicating a large-scale farming operation ([National Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/m/fred-mann/in/)). The Mann family controls extensive farmland in the county, with members Robert and Christopher Mann actively engaging in development discussions ([Giant FM](https://www.giant.fm/putnam-county/news/local-news/putnam-county-commissioners-set-to-have-final-say-on-proposed-solar-farm/)). The family partnered with solar developer EnergyRe for the proposed 4Leaf Solar project to diversify their farming operations ([Giant FM](https://www.giant.fm/parke-county/news/local-news/putnam-county-plan-commission-votes-down-solar-farm-rezone-request/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Long-established major landowners (~2,000 acres); multiple farm-related entities; prominent in local land-use debates and directly partnered with developers.

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with family decision-makers Robert and Christopher Mann; frame proposals as enhancing the farm’s legacy and profitability, given their past openness to new ventures.

citations.claim: Headquartered in Cloverdale, IN at 5008 E State Rd 42
citations.title: Public Data Profile - Fred Mann

citations.claim: Robert and Christopher Mann engaged in development discussions
citations.title: Putnam County Commissioners set to have final say on proposed solar farm

citations.claim: Partnered with solar developer EnergyRe to diversify farming
citations.title: Putnam County Plan Commission votes down solar farm rezone request

neighbors.name: Mann Family Investments LLC
neighbors.claims: Mann Family Investments LLC is a Mann family business entity used to manage land assets ([Giant FM](https://www.giant.fm/putnam-county/news/local-news/putnam-county-commissioners-set-to-have-final-say-on-proposed-solar-farm/)). In 2025, land owned by the Mann family (approximately 2,000 acres) was proposed as the site of the utility-scale 4Leaf Solar project by developer energyRe ([Terre Haute Vice](https://terrehautevice.com/2025/10/07/putnam-says-no-residents-commissioners-reject-2000-acre-solar-proposal/)). Family members Robert and Christopher Mann publicly supported the project as a means to diversify operations and improve soil quality ([Giant FM](https://www.giant.fm/parke-county/news/local-news/putnam-county-plan-commission-votes-down-solar-farm-rezone-request/)). The rezoning for the project was denied by Putnam County Commissioners in October 2025 following significant community opposition ([Indiana Economic Digest](https://indianaeconomicdigest.net/MobileContent/Most-Recent/Putnam/Article/Putnam-County-Commissioners-vote-to-deny-solar-farm-rezone/31/220/116199)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Controls large land assets; family members spoke publicly in favor of major development; directly involved in local planning decisions.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Robert Mann directly to discuss mutually beneficial development plans; leverage their interest in diversification by offering partnerships or concessions that address past community concerns.

neighbors.claims: The Crafton Thomas R Trust is associated with the Crafton family; Thomas R. Crafton was a long-time resident of Putnam County (died 2017) ([Ancestry](https://www.ancestry.com/search/collections/60525/?name=Miley+Thomas_Crafton)). The trust holds property in the county, but no public records indicate the trust or its current trustees have taken an active position on local development projects.
neighbors.influence_justification: Trust associated with an individual landowner; minimal public information available.

citations.title: Ancestry Record - Thomas R. Crafton

overview_summary: Of the 22 neighbors profiled near the project site, 17 are individual residents and 5 are organizations, with the majority (18) currently maintaining an unknown stance. While most neighbors have low influence, four high-influence figures were identified, including one individual (Skirvin) who actively opposes the project and three medium-influence professionals. Two neighbors support the development, notably the Mann family, who manage 2,000 acres of farmland and have previously explored hosting solar infrastructure. The remaining community consists primarily of multi-generational farming entities and local professionals whose positions may be influenced by agricultural preservation and economic incentives.
